headline.main: THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.; The Post-Office Appropriations. AN INVASION OF MEXICO RECOMMENDED. The Slavery Qestion in the Territories and the Supreme Court.. Temporary Adjustment of the San Juan Question.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fellow-citizens of the Senate and House of Representatives: Our deep and heartfelt gratitude is due to that Almighty Power which has bestowed upon us such varied and numerous blessings throughout the past year. The general health of the country has been excellent ; our harvests have been unu. usually plentiful, and prosperity smiles throughout the land. Indeed, notwithstanding our demerits.

headline.main: From Jefferson Territory; SNOW AND COLE WEATHER--SEVERAL PERSONS FROZEN--MERCURY CONGEALED--THE PROVISIONAL LEGISLATURE AND ITS WORKINGS--THE CITY CHARTER--DENVER AND ARIZONA CONSOLIDATED--ELECTIONS--BUSINESS ETC

docs.lead_paragraph: Last Sabbath brought with it cold weather. In the afternoon of that day a cold wind spring up, and at 9 in the evening mercury went down below zero, and on Monday evening at 9 o'clock the mercury congealed at minus thirty-nine and a-half. Liquors were frozen in most of the saloons; wines and ale bottles were broken.

docs.snippet: If wit consists in the sudden juxtaposition of incongruous ideas, Governor WISE has just delivered the wittiest speech over made upon this Western Continent. He has selected the occasion of a small medical exodus of Southern students from a Northern...
docs.lead_paragraph: If wit consists in the sudden juxtaposition of incongruous ideas, Governor WISE has just delivered the wittiest speech over made upon this Western Continent. He has selected the occasion of a small medical exodus of Southern students from a Northern city, for proclaiming his determination to maintain the American Union;

docs.snippet: The steamship Baltic, A. G. GRAY, Esq., Commander, left Aspinwall on the night of the 17th last., with the passengers and $1,408,234 in treasure which left San Francisco on the 5th, on board the Pacific Mail Steamship Company's steamer Golden Gate,...

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC COAST.; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. Eighteen Days and Twenty Hours from San Francisco. $1,408,234 IN SPECIE. Important from Central and South America.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Baltic, A. G. GRAY, Esq., Commander, left Aspinwall on the night of the 17th last., with the passengers and $1,408,234 in treasure which left San Francisco on the 5th, on board the Pacific Mail Steamship Company's steamer Golden Gate, and arrived at her deck on Saturday morning, making the through trip in 18 days 20 hours from San Francisco, the shortest passage ever made.

docs.snippet: The steamship Baltic arrived from Aspinwall on Saturday morning, bringing the California mails and treasure of Dec. 5, in the unprecedentedly quick time of eighteen days and twenty hours from San Francisco. The Baltic's list of specie is $1,408,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Baltic arrived from Aspinwall on Saturday morning, bringing the California mails and treasure of Dec. 5, in the unprecedentedly quick time of eighteen days and twenty hours from San Francisco. The Baltic's list of specie is $1,408,000.

docs.snippet: VICTOR HUGO, of all the exiles of French Democracy the most democratic, has spoken his mind in the matter of JOHN BROWN to the whole Republic of the United States. To say this is to say that he has spoken it well, with emphasis with fervor, in that...
docs.lead_paragraph: VICTOR HUGO, of all the exiles of French Democracy the most democratic, has spoken his mind in the matter of JOHN BROWN to the whole Republic of the United States. To say this is to say that he has spoken it well, with emphasis with fervor, in that clear and vigorous prose which is the prerogative of great poets.

headline.main: FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE ASIA.Important from China---The Russians to be Driven from the Amoor. THE PEACE CONGRESS.GENERAL AND MISCELLANEOUS NEWS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Asia, Captain LOTT, which sailed from Liverpool at 9 1/2 on the morning of the 10th inst., arrived here at 8 o'clock yesterday morning. The steamer New-York arrived at Southampton on the 8th inst. In future the North German Lloyd's steamers are to sail from Southampton for New-York on Wednesdays, instead of Tuesdays, as hitherto.
